statement.p: In the model \displaystyle{A}={1580}\cdot{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{23}}}}\right)} what is the percent increase or decrease?
Note all numbers are scientific measurements.

solution.p: The percent increase/decrease is calculated from \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{1}}{{23}}}}\approx{1.030595544752}. Because this is bigger than 1, this is a percent increase and the result is \displaystyle{1.030595544752}-{1}={0.030595544752009}\approx{0.031} and the percent is 3.1.
We round to 2 significant digits because the measurement (exponent) had 2 significant digits.
